show.title: RRR
show.headline: #encoRRRe presentations of the righteous historical buddy action epic

event.title: <show-title>RRR</show-title> <event-type-title>Fan CelebRRRation</event-type-title>
event.headline: #encoRRRe presentations of the righteous historical buddy action epic
event.description:
The biggest film of the decade is back on the big screen where it belongs! RRR is an exhilarating, action-packed spectacular mythologizing two real-life freedom fighters who helped lead India’s fight for independence from the British Raj, Komaram Bheem (N.T Rama Rao Jr., aka Jr NTR) and Alluri Sitarama Raju (Ram Charan). Set in the 1920s before their fight for India’s independence began, RRR imagines a fictional meeting between the two, set into motion when a young Gond girl is stolen from her village by British soldiers.

With staggeringly choreographed action sequences, an all-timer of a musical number, and a powerful story, RRR is pure big-screen joy from start to finish. Audiences across the world have been won over, it's a great big party, and you're invited – come join!

Presented in Telugu with English subtitles, and with a five-minute inteRRRmission.

show.title: Possession (1981)
show.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream

event.title: <show-title>Possession (1981)</show-title>
event.headline: A mind-bending psychosexual fever dream
event.description: Something is wrong with Anna (Isabelle Adjani). Having taken a lover, she abruptly asks her husband, Mark (Sam Neill), for divorce. He's desperate for an explanation, but Anna's answers are elusive at best. She's in crisis – becoming emotional, avoidant, self-harming, and neglectful of their son. Mark has no idea, but behind her increasingly erratic behavior is a monstrous secret. The films of Andrej Zulawski lie beyond narrative, emotion, and sanity. POSSESSION is a raw depiction of the monstrosity of marital strife and the fear of female sexuality. An arthouse favorite combining existential dread with doppelgangers, blood, and body horror, POSSESSION is truly one of a kind.

show.title: John Wick: Chapter 4
show.headline: The master of gun fu fights for his freedom

event.title: <show-title>John Wick: Chapter 4</show-title> <event-type-title>Cosplay at the Continental</event-type-title>
event.headline: Go see Charon – you'll need a suit for Cosplay at the Continental
event.description: There’s a reason no one can take down John Wick, an edge he has on every other assassin or thug that crosses his path – his sense of style. Sure, the suits are bulletproof, that helps, but really it’s the fit. Capture a little of that JOHN WICK magic by dressing up for our Cosplay at the Continental screening. Come in your best black suit, stylish dress, or anything else that makes you feel like an unkillable assassin – just leave the weaponry (real or otherwise) at home. All attendees who join us at The High Table will also receive a commemorative poster.

event.title: <show-title>The Ants & The Grasshopper</show-title><event-type-title> with Live Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: Q&A with co-director Raj Patel and Alamo Drafthouse founder Tim League
event.description: Save your seat for a special screening of the documentary THE ANTS & THE GRASSHOPPER. After the screening, there will be a Q&A with director Raj Patel and Alamo Drafthouse executive chairman/founder Tim League. Director Steve James (HOOP DREAMS, LIFE ITSELF) will moderate the Q&A in Chicago. Moderating in New York City is Mark Bittman (author, former food journalist for the New York Times, and currently Special Advisor on Food Policy at Columbia University).

show.title: TÁR
show.headline: Cate Blanchett holds the stage in a stunning portrait of a troubled artist

event.title: <show-title>TÁR</show-title> <event-type-title>Lydia Tár Dress-Up Screening</event-type-title>
event.headline: We’re conducting a stylish TÁR dress-up screening
event.description: Lydia Tár may be a deeply problematic figure, but there’s one thing about her that we can fully endorse – her wardrobe. If you agree, then join us for a tastefully stylish TÁR Dress-Up Screening. Don’t worry if you don’t have any suits with coattails hanging in your closet, just come in anything that makes you think of the troubling maestro. From her slicked-back hair, conducting tails, baggy sweats, and chic workout gear, we might not like her behavior, but we can still admire her look.

show.title: Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure
show.headline: History is about to be rewritten by two guys who can't spell...

event.title: <show-title>Bill & Ted's Excellent Adventure</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: "Be excellent to each other. And...PARTY ON, DUDES!" – Abe Lincoln
event.description:
Let's face it, Keanu Reeves is a prophet, philosopher, and teacher whose work constantly attempts to free our minds and better our lives. Example numero uno: this 1989 classic about two dudes, Ted "Theodore" Logan (Reeves) and Bill S. Preston, Esq. (Alex Winters), who seem to be complete idiots but are, in fact, the future of rock 'n' roll and the founders of a utopian society.

But, before they can fulfill this destiny, they need to not fail history "most heinously." So with a little help from future dude Rufus (a most excellent George Carlin) and a time-traveling phone booth, the pair embark on a mission to collect some of the world's most esteemed historical figures for their history presentation. In the words, er, word of the man himself: Whoa.

While just watching BILL & TED'S EXCELLENT ADVENTURE is already most non-heinous, at our Movie Party you can LIVE the adventure thanks to a stuffed phone booth worth of props – Inflatable guitars! Guitar picks! Phone keychains! – and pre-movie shenanigans to truly celebrate the righteousness of those Wyld Stallyns in a theater packed with fellow acolytes. Whoa, indeed.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.
